headline.main: FIVE U.S. FLIERS SLAIN IN LEAP FROM PLANE; Lone Survivor Tells of Attack by Japanese Over Burma

lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI, India, June 2 (AP) -- The story of a Japanese attack on American airmen who parachuted from a crippled bomber was told here today in an official dispatch following an account given by the only known survivor, Sergeant Marvin W. Beckman of Inglewood, Calif.
abstract: Sgt M W Beckman, sole survivor, describes Jap machine-gunning of plane crew parachuting from disabled bomber over Irrawaddy River
